meanings.definition: Open, honest, and direct in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: She appreciated his frank opinion on the matter.
meanings.sent2: It is refreshing to have a friend who is always frank with you.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's frank feedback helped the student improve.
meanings.sent4: Her frank demeanor made her a trustworthy leader.
meanings.sent5: His frank admission of guilt surprised everyone.

meanings.definition: To mark an item with the postage necessary for sending it by mail.
meanings.sent1: Please frank the letter before dropping it in the mailbox.
meanings.sent2: I need to frank this package before the post office closes.
meanings.sent3: He forgot to frank the envelope, so the letter was returned.
meanings.sent4: She carefully franked each postcard before mailing them out.
meanings.sent5: Don't forget to frank the parcel to ensure it reaches its destination.

meanings.definition: A member of a Germanic people who invaded the Western Roman Empire in the 5th century.
meanings.sent1: The history book mentioned the Frank tribe's invasion.
meanings.sent2: My ancestors were Franks who settled in this region.
meanings.sent3: The costume party had someone dressed as a Frank warrior.
meanings.sent4: The legend tells of a brave Frank leader who fought for freedom.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit showcased artifacts from the Frank civilization.
